description: Evapotranspiration Package - Simulates the effects of plant transpiration and direct evaporation by removing water from the saturated groundwater regime

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: NEVTOP
variables.description: ET option code. 1=ET from top layer only, 2=ET from layer specified by IEVT, 3=ET from highest active cell.
variables.tooltip: 1=ET removed from layer 1 only. 2=ET removed from layer specified by IEVT array. 3=ET removed from highest active cell in each column.

variables.name: IEVTCB
variables.description: Unit number for cell-by-cell ET flow terms. 0=no output, >0=write to this unit.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, cell-by-cell ET flow terms saved to binary file. If 0, no cell-by-cell output.

variables.name: INSURF
variables.description: Flag for reading ET surface array. >=0=read new SURF, <0=reuse previous.
variables.tooltip: If >= 0, a new ET surface elevation array is read. If < 0, reuse from previous stress period.

variables.name: INEVTR
variables.description: Flag for reading maximum ET rate array. >=0=read new EVTR, <0=reuse previous.
variables.tooltip: If >= 0, a new maximum ET rate array is read. If < 0, reuse from previous stress period.

variables.name: INEXDP
variables.description: Flag for reading extinction depth array. >=0=read new EXDP, <0=reuse previous.
variables.tooltip: If >= 0, a new extinction depth array is read. If < 0, reuse from previous stress period.

variables.name: INIEVT
variables.description: Flag for reading ET layer indicator. >=0=read new IEVT, <0=reuse previous. Only if NEVTOP=2.
variables.tooltip: If >= 0, a new layer indicator array is read. If < 0, reuse from previous. Only read when NEVTOP=2.

variables.name: SURF
variables.description: Elevation of the ET surface (L). ET occurs at the maximum rate when the water table is at or above this elevation.
variables.tooltip: 2D array of ET surface elevations. Typically set to land surface elevation. ET rate is maximum when head equals SURF.

variables.name: EVTR
variables.tooltip: 2D array of maximum ET rate. Applied when head is at or above the ET surface. ET decreases linearly to zero at the extinction depth.

variables.name: EXDP
variables.description: ET extinction depth (L) below the ET surface.
variables.tooltip: 2D array of extinction depths. ET ceases when the water table drops below SURF - EXDP. Typical values: 1-5 meters depending on vegetation.

variables.name: IEVT
variables.description: Layer number from which ET is removed for each vertical column (1-based).
variables.tooltip: 2D array specifying which layer ET is applied to at each column location. Only read when NEVTOP=2.
